programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger

programme.title: Battlestar Galactica
programme.desc: Part two of two. Commander Cain appears to have learned nothing from the fate of his last ship, continuing to press for war with the Cylons and riding roughshod over Starbuck's feelings by resuming his relationship with Cassiopea - until he endangers the fleet and pushes Adama too far. Guest starring Lloyd Bridges

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Riker finds himself cast as an inmate of a mental asylum in one of Dr Crusher's plays. However, he soon finds fantasy and reality blurring into one. Sci-fi adventure, starring Jonathan Frakes

programme.title: The Gambler V: Playing for Keeps
programme.desc: Part one of two. Brady Hawkes hits the trail once again to look for his son Jeremiah, last seen with Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid. The Gambler fears if he doesn't reach him in time, the Wild Bunch will lead his son astray, and into trouble with the law. Western, starring Kenny Rogers, Loni Anderson and Scott Paulin

programme.title: The Gambler V: Playing for Keeps
programme.desc: Part two of two. Brady Hawkes hits the trail once again to look for Jeremiah, last seen in a newspaper clipping with Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid. Second World War drama, starring Richard Todd, Bernard Lee, Michael Wilding, Richard Attenborough and Donald Houston

The elite soldiers of an SAS rescue team are sent to resolve the crisis, and must fight their way to the captive a floor at a time without attracting attention. Action thriller, starring Tom Benedict Knight and Simon Phillips

Horror thriller, starring Olga Kurylenko and Javier Botet

The pair search for a link between the two deaths, and Jane's quest for the truth puts her life in danger. Crime drama, starring Claire Goose

With just four places in the quarter final up for grabs, the pressure is on

programme.desc: Gordon celebrates the very best of British - exquisite produce and the pinnacle of fine dining. First, he invites his entrepreneurs to the Fish Society in Surrey where he tasks them with perfectly de-shelling one of the most expensive foods to be found on any menu - lobster. He then puts the contenders in charge of his high-end Mayfair restaurant, Lucky Cat. With his reputation on the line and paying diners expecting immaculate food and service, he expects them to live up to his own extraordinarily high standards in order to have any hope of proceeding in the competition

Here, dealers Adi, Melissa, JB, Moses, Lucy, Samantha and Ian bid against one another on a set of mid-century cinema-style seats, Victorian wooden spinning tops, a silver cigarette case, a creepy head-shaped pot and an iconic 1960s movie poster

programme.desc: Alex Jones and Rylan look ahead to the Eurovision Grand Final and pop star Mika meets some of the people behind the biggest Eurovision hits

programme.title: Eurovision Song Contest - Everyone's a Winner
programme.desc: Taking top spot at Eurovision guarantees fame and fortune - but failing to win is no bar to success either. Fleur East and a panel of celebrity Eurovision super-fans toast the 20 most successful Eurovision songs that didn't win. These are entrants whose songs have gone on to rack up millions of internet views and streams worldwide. Contributors include Claire Sweeney, Scott Mills and Paddy O'Connell

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The last quarter-final sees the week's most talented four cooks return to fight for a place in Knockout Week. They must prepare two courses that will impress not just regular judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also from the 2014 series Ping Coombes, the 2015 series Simon Wood and 2020 series finalist Claire Fyfe

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Comedy actress Diane Morgan hosts, as comedian Desiree Burch and journalist and Times Radio presenter Matt Chorley join in the fun on the satirical current affairs quiz, alongside regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton

programme.title: Black Ops
programme.desc: Undercover police officers Dom and Kay are in a mess - frightened and on their own they have Clinton's body to bury. Dom recalls that Clinton said he was 'protected' and reasons that someone else must know about this mission. They decide to head to Clinton's house, but on the way bump into fellow PCSO Kieran Price who questions their very shaky story about why they're caked in mud. Clinton's house yields an interesting discovery - but Dom and Kay are not the only ones breaking in. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo, Hammed Animashaun and Colin Hoult

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Chris & Rosie Ramsey Show
programme.desc: The married couple welcome guests including comedian Joel Dommett and model Hannah Cooper - plus members of the public - to poke fun at life, relationships, annoyances, parenting and absolutely everything in-between. Featuring Please Keep Me Anonymous, where a well-known face reads out some terrifying audience confessions and It Goes or I Go, where audience members compete to rid themselves of something their loved one refuses to remove from the house

programme.title: The Monuments Men (2014)
programme.desc: Seven experts in fine art are assembled into a military platoon during the Second World War, and given an unusual mission. They are sent into occupied Europe to recover priceless works of art that have fallen into Nazi hands and ensure the masterpieces survive the conflict. Fact-based drama, directed by and starring George Clooney. With Matt Damon, Bill Murray and Cate Blanchett

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive makes a wriggly catch on a fishing expedition across Europe's biggest volcanic lake, and discovers how scientists are fighting to save an ancient citadel from destruction

programme.title: 24/7 Pet Hospital
programme.desc: Puppy Coal, from the Dogs Trust is treated for aspiration pneumonia, caused by food going into his lungs. Border Collie puppy Grayson has broken his leg after falling off a bed and needs an operation to fix it. A new scan technique is used for the first time to check if labradoodle Poppy is cancer free

programme.title: Take a Hike
programme.desc: The latest walk in north west Wales is hosted by fitness fan Zara, who takes the group up - and down - the Great Orme, but it remains to be seen if she impresses the other hikers

programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: My Million Pound Menu
programme.desc: Fred Sirieix meets the teams behind two more food concepts seeking money to start up their own restaurants. Trap Kitchen is a soul food-inspired takeaway from south London selling lobster tails, waffles, mac 'n' cheese and prawns in food boxes prepared in owner Prince's own sound London home, while Greedy Khao is a vegan Thai grab-and-go concept established by husband and wife Lee and Faai. Will the investors like what they see?

programme.title: Wonders of the Universe
programme.desc: Professor Brian Cox continues his exploration of the origins of mankind by investigating the matter from which everything on Earth is formed. At a Hindu cremation in Nepal, he discusses the faith's philosophy of life as an eternal cycle of creation and destruction, and draws a parallel with the lives of the universe's stars - before revealing why everything on Earth was once a part of something else

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: Sara Pascoe hosts the quarter-final, which takes the sewers back to the golden era of 1930s fashion. Judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young challenge them to follow the pattern for a pair of women's sailor trousers, which have a complex bib-front opening and equally tricky pockets. They then transform men's shirts into women's blouses, before perfectly fitting a bias-cut evening gown reminiscent of outfits worn by Hollywood stars Katharine Hepburn and Bette Davis

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: The team heads to Stockport Town Hall in Greater Manchester, where Philip Serrell examines a collection of evocative war diaries and Mark Stacey falls for a mosaic necklace and earring set. Paul Martin takes time out to explore the history behind the town's air-raid shelters

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher, Louise Minchin, Chris Washington and Kimberly Wyatt continue to go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive goes off the tourist track in Rome, trying his hand at Italy's fastest growing sport, staying in the city's most unusual hotel and having a go at an ancient Roman art form

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Mediterranean Adventure
programme.desc: The bikers ride across the Balearic islands Menorca and Majorca, sampling great produce and finding out about the British influence in the Mediterranean from the 17th century to the present day. They reveal how mayonnaise was invented in Menorca's capital of Mahon, sample Menorcan gin, and meet British chef Mark Fosh, who has lived in Majorca for more than 20 years. Recipes include cuttlefish stew and squid salad with mayonnaise, fish and chips in gin and tonic batter, and sea bass a la mallorquina and saffron potato puree

programme.title: Designing the Hebrides
programme.desc: Interior designer Banjo Beale is pushed out of his comfort zone when the Isle of Mull Rugby Club hire him to redesign their dated bar. The members are keen to reflect the club's rich history, but with a large space to fill and little knowledge of sport, Banjo admits it's a challenging task to undertake

programme.title: Wales' Home of the Year
programme.desc: The search for Wales' Home of the Year 2022 continues with visits to properties in the South West. Judges Owain Wyn Evans, Mandy Watkins and Glen Thomas must choose between an Edwardian townhouse in Mumbles, a converted watermill near Ammanford and a reimagined cottage in Kidwelly by scoring them on architectural merit, distinctive design and original style

programme.title: Turkey: Empire of Erdogan
programme.desc: Part two of two. A look at the Turkish president's response to an attempted military coup in 2016, using emergency powers to crack down even harder on dissent and taking control of the armed forces and judiciary

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: Lance is obsessed with finding the thief that stole his gold, which means he can ignore the melodrama going on at home, while Andy's lies are catching up with him too, and the pair decide camping out is the safest option

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Red Joan (2018)
programme.desc: An elderly widow is arrested for treason, and shares the story of her life as the KGB's longest serving agent in the British government. Recruited as an idealistic radical in the 1930s, she spent decades providing the Soviet Union with details of Britain's nuclear weapons - in the hope that neither nation would gain the edge in the arms race. Espionage drama based on Jennie Rooney's novel, starring Judi Dench, Sophie Cookson and Nina Sosanya

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Kostas Papagiannopoulos's surgical list includes 79-year-old Barry, who has a suspicious growth on his lung. Previous attempts to diagnose it have failed, so Kostas uses keyhole surgery to remove a section of lung before sending it off for immediate analysis, waiting in theatre in case he has to proceed further. Meanwhile, Andrew Hogarth treats 52-year-old Roger, who has been on the cardiac ward for a week with a life-threatening infection

programme.title: Iolo's Borderlands
programme.desc: Iolo Williams explores Monmouthshire, looks for a rare bee on the Gwent Levels and finds fallow deer in the Wye Valley, as well as a heavily camouflaged bird near Abergavenny. Iolo ends this portion of his journey at Llanthony Priory, where house martins are nesting in the ruins

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: In the Lake District, Gordon tasks the contenders to collect pine needles and cones from 40-foot trees to infuse into Michelin-starred Mille Feuille in a bid to demonstrate how they can turn humble ingredients into profit. Next, they create bottled sauces to sell at HWKR Market in Gateshead, Tyne and Wear. It's a crowded market, so will anyone impress the secret industry greats Gordon has invited to the venue - and will anyone convince Sauce Shop enough to launch their brand as a 'special edition'?

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive goes off the tourist track in Rome, trying his hand at Italy's fastest growing sport, staying in the city's most unusual hotel and having a go at an ancient Roman art form

programme.title: Between the Covers
programme.desc: Sara Cox is joined by TV presenter Nick Knowles, comedian Sara Barron, musical theatre star Ore Oduba, and wine expert Helen McGinn, who champion their favourite books. The guests also review this week's two book club choices, which are Hungry Ghosts by Kevin Jared Hosein, and I'm Not Scared by Niccolo Ammaniti

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: Undercover cops pick up an international gang of pickpockets. A couple are stunned to find a stranger in their hallway, and a reckless lorry driver reverses on a motorway into oncoming traffic. Presented by Dominic Littlewood

programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: My Million Pound Menu
programme.desc: Fred Sirieix welcomes another two food brands to Manchester, where the owners pitch their businesses to high-street investors in the hope of opening their own restaurants. Up this week are Bubble&, the brainchild of husband and wife Rupert and Marita, who want to market bubble-and-squeak as a dish as versatile as pizza and pasta. Also up is former cookery school teacher Jay Morjaria, who has a dream of opening a string of East Asian-inspired restaurants. He has a name for the first one - Dynasty - all he needs now is 600,000 investment

programme.title: Wonders of the Universe
programme.desc: Professor Brian Cox explores how gravity influences events across the universe, discovering why such a relatively weak force dictates Earth's orbit around the Sun - as well as the solar system's movement through the galaxy. He also explains why the gravity of a neutron star is much stronger than that of Earth, and looks back through history to reveal why scientists' research into the power of attraction has given mankind a far greater understanding of the cosmos

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: Sara Pascoe presents the semi-final, which celebrates Japanese design and sewing. For the pattern challenge, Esme Young has collaborated with a Japanese designer to come up with a kimono-inspired dress, while the transformation task sees the sewers mending worn-out denim using Eastern techniques of embroidery and applique. The made-to-measure sees them fitting an outfit to their models which has elements of origami folds and pleats - and with the final just a week away, the stakes are higher than ever

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Revisiting some of the locations from the series, including Greenwich Royal Naval College, Althorp House in Northamptonshire, and Herstmonceux Castle, East Sussex

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher, Louise Minchin, Chris Washington and Kimberly Wyatt keep their eyes on the prize ahead of Friday's final, while Richard Osman asks the questions

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: The newsreader submerges himself in the famous hot springs of Saturnia. He also joins Italy's last surviving cowboys, known as the Butteri, to learn how to lasso and barbecue the perfect steak

programme.title: Amol Rajan Interviews
programme.desc: The journalist speaks to the TV presenter

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Lochs
programme.desc: Paul Murton explores the Argyll coast, starting from the sacred sands of Kilmory Bay on Loch Sween, and including a visit to Lilly Loch in Knapdale Forest

programme.title: DNA Family Secrets
programme.desc: Stacey Dooley helps people unlock mysteries hidden in their DNA - from discovering lost ancestry and tracking down missing relatives to detecting diseases before it's too late. Richard is on a life-long mission to discover the identity of his father, Janet is rattled by a rumour that her Dad fathered a baby as a prisoner of war during the Second World War and she might have a secret sister, while Glen is desperate to finally learn his ethnicity, as his mother never knew where his father was from

programme.title: Guilt
programme.desc: Max, Jake and their new gang hide from Maggie in Edinburgh, uncovering her hidden link to Sir Jim Sturrock. Back in Leith, Teddy tells her he carried out her orders to kill the brothers, but she is unwilling to hand over the money he's owed and exerts pressure on him, going to great lengths to get him back on side. Aliza uncovers critical information that puts the sale of the bank at risk, while Sheila manipulates Jake into doubting whether he can trust Max

programme.title: Inside No 9
programme.desc: You get to meet all sorts when you go online dating, as Vicky's about to find out. Will she finally meet her perfect match, or will Vicky be talking to the Lonely Hearts Killer? Dark comedy written by and starring Steve Pemberton and Reece Shearsmith, with Claire Rushbrook, Mathew Horne, Frances Barber and Asim Chaudhry

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Turkey: Empire of Erdogan
programme.desc: First in a two-part documentary about the life and career of the Turkish president. Recep Tayyip Erdogan was born at a time when Turkey was ruled by the secular elite. Joining an Islamist party, he became hugely popular as mayor of Istanbul. But with the national constitution forbidding the mixing of religion and politics, Erdogan was sent to prison and banned from being an MP for life - only to stage an astonishing comeback

programme.title: Turkey: Empire of Erdogan
programme.desc: Part two of two. A look at the Turkish president's response to an attempted military coup in 2016, using emergency powers to crack down even harder on dissent and taking control of the armed forces and judiciary

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace finds out how Jaffa Cakes are made on a visit to the Manchester factory where McVitie's churn out 1.4 billion of them every year. He follows the process from the delivery of a pre-blended wheat delivery - a pre-blended secret ingredient that gives the cake their light texture - to mixing, baking, jam piping and the addition of the chocolate topping. Away from the factory, historian Ruth Goodman finds out about the historic legal case which saw the company defending their right to call the product a cake and not a biscuit

programme.title: Reunion Hotel
programme.desc: Arleen, the daughter of a Holocaust survivor, thanks Chris, the man whose grandparents hid her mother to save her life. Alex Jones also meets ex-soldier Nathan, who was sent to Belfast for his first operational tour at 18. His behaviour took a downward spiral, including what he recalls as causing trouble for his commanding officer, so he seeks forgiveness from his former platoon officer

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The third quarter-final sees the week's most talented four cooks return to fight for a place in Knockout Week. They must cook two courses that will excite not just regular judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also 2019 champion Irini Tzortzoglou, 2021 champion Tom Rhodes and 2018 semi-finalist Nisha Parmar

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph boards a ferry to view a traditional cottage in Ventnor on the Isle of Wight, while Dion Dublin checks out an end-terrace in Bradford as well as following a two-year project in Derby to build eight homes on land formerly used as garages and workshops

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: The newsreader submerges himself in the famous hot springs of Saturnia. He also joins Italy's last surviving cowboys, known as the Butteri, to learn how to lasso and barbecue the perfect steak

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares for late spring and summer, sowing poppies and planting cornflowers for colour and interest in the Paradise Garden. Toby Buckland revels in some fabulous spring planting on a visit to the magnificent, landscaped gardens of Melbourne Hall in Derbyshire. Rachel de Thame meets a passionate dahlia grower who was once a florist working at the White House for President Obama and the First Lady

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Politics UK
programme.desc: The week's political proceedings around the UK

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: My Million Pound Menu
programme.desc: Another two food brands seek investment. Naked Dough, operating as a pop-up in London, serves a vegan-friendly dough developed by pastry chef and co-founder Jen. They now want 250,000 to open their own shop. Premium burger stall Black Bear Burger has allowed husband and wife Liz and Stew to leave their jobs and focus full-time on the business. Now they want to take the next step but they need investment if they are to open a proper outlet. Fred Sirieix meets the teams and follows their pitches

programme.title: Wonders of the Universe
programme.desc: Professor Brian Cox reveals how the unique properties of light provide an insight into the origins and evolution of both mankind and the universe. He charts the importance of light in the development of the world's ancient civilisations, and explains how the speed of light allows the measurement of both distance and time - before pinpointing one of the most important moments in the evolution of life on Earth

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: Sara Pascoe presents the grand final, but before the winner can be crowned remaining contestants Annie, Brogan, Debra and Man Yee have the small matter of three more fashion challenges. They begin by following the pattern for an amorphous dress, made from a single piece of elastene and manipulated into shape with a connection of D-rings. They are then presented with all their scraps from the previous weeks, from which they must create a party outfit, before fitting a made-to-measure red-carpet jumpsuit to their models. Who will impress judges Esme Young and Patrick Grant the most?

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Mark Stacey and Jonathan Pratt find a collection of objects at the Old Royal Naval College in Greenwich, and Paul Martin takes a ride along the Thames on an amphibious vehicle

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher, Louise Minchin, Chris Washington and Kimberly Wyatt take part in the final challenges before the winner is announced by Richard Osman

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive makes gelato and learns why it is healthier than ice cream, gets a makeover from Florence's most stylish man, and stays in a hotel that is a homage to Italian design

programme.title: Iolo's Borderlands
programme.desc: Iolo Williams explores north-east Wales, beginning his journey on a moor near Llangollen to see hen harriers, one of the UK's most threatened birds of prey. He also visits a nature reserve on a bog, discovers the wildlife that has colonised Marford Quarry, and ends his journey on the Dee Estuary, where he sees thousands of wading birds near Point of Ayr

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: George Anderson trials new blueberry bushes, and Calum Clunie demonstrates more garden produce to plant at home. One of the nation's favourite flowers, sweet peas, get planted out ready to bring colour and fragrance wherever they are cultivated, and Lizzie Schofield starts working with a family who has just moved into a new-build estate

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In a special programme from the RHS Malvern Spring Festival, Rachel de Thame and Nick Bailey explore show gardens and discover the newest varieties of plants and flowers. Elsewhere, Toby Buckland celebrates spring colour at Aberglasney Gardens in Carmarthenshire, and Arit Anderson spends the day with a charity group that gives horticultural work experience to vulnerable people and those with learning difficulties

programme.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
programme.desc: A look at some of the UK's most beautiful and historic homes, and people who are saving the past for all of us. This episode features Hardwick Hall in Derbyshire, an Elizabethan masterpiece, commissioned by the formidable Bess of Hardwick in the late 1500s

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer head to the River Exe in Devon, where they fish for summer grilse, and a trip to the beach sees them try their hand at shore fishing. Away from the fishing, Bob finds a shady corner to prepare a vegan lunch for them both, using a special blend of car meat, and as the day draws to a close they head back to their accommodation and enjoy a game of cricket on the lawn, in which Bob proves himself to be surprisingly agile

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories with Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: MOTDx
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas and the team reveal more of the lifestyle and culture that surrounds the Premier League and those involved in it

programme.title: Colin from Accounts
programme.desc: The Echo Park gang are impressed when Ashley takes charge during a power outage. Australian comedy starring Patrick Brammall and Harriet Dyer

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: In the quarter-final of the competition the designers are split into teams of two to makeover two wooden lodges used as wedding accommodation on the banks of Rutland Water in the East Midlands. With one team working on the bridal lodge and the other on the groom's room they have 3,000, an army of tradespeople and just two days to create a winning design that will impress Michelle and guest judge Shayne Brady and secure them a place in the semi-final

programme.title: Inside Taiwan: Standing up to China
programme.desc: Jane Corbin travels to Taiwan to take viewers inside a story that has ramifications for all of us. In the process, she reveals China's 'playbook' as its desire to 'reunify the motherland' becomes ever clearer, and it could drag the world into a dangerous confrontation

programme.title: Our Changing Planet
programme.desc: Part one of two. The second year of a seven-year project to save the planet's endangered ecosystems. Chris Packham is in Greenland to learn more about the rate at which snow and ice are melting and retreating in the Arctic. Liz Bonnin returns to California to investigate surprising solutions for the state's wildfire season, and Steve Backshall travels to the Maldives, a country facing significant challenges because of climate change

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's tour reaches its final stop, Singapore, where he learns about the island city's maritime origins and the vision of the 19th-century Englishman who put it on the map. At the bar of the Raffles Hotel, he treats himself to a Singapore sling, now a world-famous cocktail, takes a boat down the river and dines with an artist and his family in Chinatown

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc: The steeplejack takes a look at the extraordinary expansion of industrial Britain in the 18th and 19th centuries, and the continued use of huge steam engines in collieries, steelworks and mills in the 20th century

programme.title: Chris Packham's Animal Einsteins
programme.desc: Chris takes a look at nature's best navigators, with mule deer building up complicated memory maps of their landscapes so they don't get lost, while elephants rely on the knowledge of the herd's matriarch to find precious waterholes. Dung beetles plot routes by reading the stars, while the mantis shrimp has one of the most complex navigation systems in the natural world. For many species of fish and birds, there's safety in numbers and they often travel in vast shoals and flocks - but who leads the way, and how do they decide?

programme.title: World of Stonehenge
programme.desc: Neil Oliver reports on a 5,000-year-old temple discovered in Orkney. Built 500 years before Stonehenge, the undisturbed artefacts found there, including wall decorations, pigments and paint pots, are helping to increase knowledge and understanding of the Neolithic people. Special effects are used to re-create the structure in 3D, allowing Neil to walk inside and explore it

programme.title: The Lost Language of Cranes (1991)
programme.desc: A young man comes out to his parents, causing repercussions for his father, who has long since been trying his own sexuality and realises he can no longer live a lie. Drama, starring Brian Cox, Brian Cox, Eileen Atkins and Angus Macfadyen

programme.title: Britain and the Sea
programme.desc: Broadcaster David Dimbleby sails his yacht Rocket around the British coastline, exploring different aspects of the nation's maritime history, art and architecture along the way. He begins by sailing the south-west coast of Devon and Cornwall, where he tells the story of Sir Francis Drake and an array of adventurers, explorers, pirates and smugglers. He also welcomes record-breaking solo yachtswoman Ellen MacArthur on board and learns about one of the oldest maritime art forms of all - the tattoo, before agreeing to have one himself

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's tour reaches its final stop, Singapore, where he learns about the island city's maritime origins and the vision of the 19th-century Englishman who put it on the map. At the bar of the Raffles Hotel, he treats himself to a Singapore sling, now a world-famous cocktail, takes a boat down the river and dines with an artist and his family in Chinatown

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc: The steeplejack takes a look at the extraordinary expansion of industrial Britain in the 18th and 19th centuries, and the continued use of huge steam engines in collieries, steelworks and mills in the 20th century

programme.title: H2O: The Molecule That Made Us
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the importance of water to civilisation, beginning with a look at how just a few drops can cause deserts to bloom, create rivers in the air and drive the great animal migrations

programme.title: Crossing England in a Punt: River of Dreams
programme.desc: Tom Fort embarks on a 170-mile journey down the River Trent in his own custom-built punt. The presenter encounters the power stations that generate much of the nation's electricity, meets veterans of the floods of 1947 and learns about a Bronze Age boatman who made a life on the banks as he discovers the waterway's 3,000-year history

programme.title: London to Brighton: Side By Side
programme.desc: In 1953, the BBC commissioned a recording filmed from the point-of-view of a London to Brighton train. In 1983, another film of the same journey was recorded. This short programme presents these two iconic recordings side-by-side, demonstrating how both locomotive technology and the landscape have evolved over the years

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo is in the island city-state of Singapore on the last leg of his 2,500-mile exploration of south-east Asia. In Tai Seng he marvels at the world's largest subterranean rail depot where self-driving MRT trains are operated. He then takes a cable car to the island of Sentosa where he learns about one of Britain's worst military defeats and the brutal Japanese occupation that followed. At the Singapore Stock Exchange, Michael appreciates the island's success as a financial centre and, in the residential district of Ang Mo Kio, visits an urban farm of the future - on a car park roof

programme.title: Ken Dodd's Liverpool Walkabout
programme.desc: A tour of Liverpool with comedian Ken Dodd, a proud lifelong resident of the city's Knotty Ash district

programme.title: Ken Dodd: How Tickled We Were
programme.desc: A celebration of the life and work of the comedian, recounting his life from his boyhood growing up in the 1930s in Knotty Ash through to his big break and continued career in showbusiness. Dodd's career spanned 50 years and after his rapid rise to stardom, he maintained his presence via countless television and radio shows, theatre tours and summer seasons with work ranging from pantomime to Shakespeare. He also enjoyed a spell as a successful recording artist and remained active until just a few months before his death aged 90. This programme features contributions from his friends and colleagues and includes an interview with his widow Anne

programme.title: The Shawshank Redemption (1994)
programme.desc: A banker is wrongly jailed for his wife's murder and over the course of a life sentence he forms a close friendship with a fellow inmate. He also earns a position of trust as book-keeper to the corrupt prison governor - but makes an enemy of his benefactor as he tries to clear his name. Frank Darabont's drama, starring Tim Robbins, Morgan Freeman, Bob Gunton, William Sadler, Clancy Brown and Gil Bellows

programme.title: Film Stars Don't Die in Liverpool (2017)
programme.desc: Real life proves to be just as dramatic off-screen as it does on it for ageing Hollywood superstar Gloria Grahame and her much younger lover, Peter Turner. As their mismatched romance waxes and wanes over time, events conspire to keep them in each other's lives even when it proves to be difficult and demanding. Romantic drama, starring Jamie Bell and Annette Bening

programme.title: Deep Ocean
programme.desc: Documentary about the first scientific research undertaken in a submersible in the Antarctic. Three marine biologists use customised UHD cameras to capture ling the extraordinary forms of life that thrive in the Southern Ocean on film. Narrated by David Attenborough

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo is in the island city-state of Singapore on the last leg of his 2,500-mile exploration of south-east Asia. In Tai Seng he marvels at the world's largest subterranean rail depot where self-driving MRT trains are operated. He then takes a cable car to the island of Sentosa where he learns about one of Britain's worst military defeats and the brutal Japanese occupation that followed. At the Singapore Stock Exchange, Michael appreciates the island's success as a financial centre and, in the residential district of Ang Mo Kio, visits an urban farm of the future - on a car park roof

programme.title: Paul McCartney at the BBC
programme.desc: A compilation of TV appearances from the musician's post-Beatles career, featuring performances of songs including Band on the Run, Jet, Coming Up and Live and Let Die on programmes from Top of the Pops to the Electric Proms. There is also rarely seen backstage footage and interviews, as well as appearances by a range of familiar faces, including a recent encounter with die-hard Beatles fan Bob Mortimer

programme.title: Rock Family Trees
programme.desc: The Liverpool music scene of the 1960s, an era synonymous with the band that changed the face of pop music - the Beatles. Pete Frame narrates the story of such bands including the Searchers, Gerry and the Pacemakers, Billy J Kramer, the Swinging Blue Jeans and the Merseybeats

programme.title: Everything: The Real Thing Story
programme.desc: The rise of four working class boys from one of Liverpool's toughest neighbourhoods, who fought hardship and discrimination to become the biggest-selling black group in British pop history. With a string of hits, they dominated the international charts throughout the 1970s with iconic songs like You to Me Are Everything, Can't Get by Without You, and Can You Feel the Force. Hpwever the group's meteoric success was also tempered with personal tragedy, drug addiction and racial prejudice. Narrated by Jacob Anderson

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: A one-off special about Staggering Storytellers, taking a look at some of literature's greatest works and history's wackiest writers. Along the way the development of storytelling technology is observed, it is revealed how a party at Lord Byron's house led to the writing of the Gothic masterpiece Frankenstein, and how Charles Dickens was the Harry Styles of his day. Spanning 3,000 years of recorded history, the programme takes a look at the funny and ridiculous ways some of the finest writers cured their writing block

programme.desc: Leo's family is from Russia, and they have shown him how to make a special sharlotka, a simple Russian apple cake. Leo starts by separating the eggs. He then adds sugar and flour to the yolks and mixes them together until the mixture is smooth. He whisks the egg whites until they are stiff and stirs them into the yolk mix. After this, Leo cuts apples into small chunks and places half of them in a cake tin, pours over the egg mixture and puts the rest of the apples on top. Then the sharlotka is ready to be baked in the oven. Leo even has an extra special Russian-themed surprise for his friends while they eat! Can they work out what his special ingredient is?

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: Still reeling from the state she found her dad in last night, Niamh suggests he might be suffering from post-traumatic stress disorder following his car crash. Meanwhile, a blues festival take a sinister when a woman arrested for driving while intoxicated claims that she was spiked

programme.title: Countryfile Spring Diaries
programme.desc: Jules Hudson visits a charity that helps to rehome bereaved pets, Paul Martin meets a community who are determined save the last native British daffodil and Ellie Harrison explores some tree houses for grown-ups

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton travels to rural Perth and Kinross on a mission to help a young couple from Edinburgh realise their dream of a new lifestyle in a rural home

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers welcomes five more sellers to the Bidding Room, where they try to sell items to five professional dealers who are on the lookout for interesting pieces, with help from expert Simon Bower. Here, dealers Adi, Melissa, JB, Moses, Lucy, Samantha and Ian bid against one another on a set of mid-century cinema-style seats, Victorian wooden spinning tops, a silver cigarette case, a creepy head-shaped pot and an iconic 1960s movie poster

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Former Coronation Street Sally Lindsay reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Rylan look ahead to the Eurovision Grand Final and pop star Mika meets some of the people behind the biggest Eurovision hits

programme.title: Eurovision Song Contest - Everyone's a Winner
programme.desc: Taking top spot at Eurovision guarantees fame and fortune - but failing to win is no bar to success either. Fleur East and a panel of celebrity Eurovision super-fans toast the 20 most successful Eurovision songs that didn't win. These are entrants whose songs have gone on to rack up millions of internet views and streams worldwide. Contributors include Claire Sweeney, Scott Mills and Paddy O'Connell

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The last quarter-final sees the week's most talented four cooks return to fight for a place in Knockout Week. They must prepare two courses that will impress not just regular judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also from the 2014 series Ping Coombes, the 2015 series Simon Wood and 2020 series finalist Claire Fyfe

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Comedy actress Diane Morgan hosts, as comedian Desiree Burch and journalist and Times Radio presenter Matt Chorley join in the fun on the satirical current affairs quiz, alongside regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton

programme.title: Rewind: 60 Years of Welsh Pop
programme.desc: A whirlwind ride thorough the history of Welsh Eurovision contenders, featuring performances from Mary Hopkin, Jessica Garlick, Lucie Jones, 1976 winners Brotherhood of Man and, of course, Welsh icon Bonnie Tyler. Plus, plenty of Eurovision fun facts and frivolity

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Chris & Rosie Ramsey Show
programme.desc: The married couple welcome guests including comedian Joel Dommett and model Hannah Cooper - plus members of the public - to poke fun at life, relationships, annoyances, parenting and absolutely everything in-between. Featuring Please Keep Me Anonymous, where a well-known face reads out some terrifying audience confessions and It Goes or I Go, where audience members compete to rid themselves of something their loved one refuses to remove from the house

programme.title: Black Ops
programme.desc: Undercover police officers Dom and Kay are in a mess - frightened and on their own they have Clinton's body to bury. Dom recalls that Clinton said he was 'protected' and reasons that someone else must know about this mission. They decide to head to Clinton's house, but on the way bump into fellow PCSO Kieran Price who questions their very shaky story about why they're caked in mud. Clinton's house yields an interesting discovery - but Dom and Kay are not the only ones breaking in. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo, Hammed Animashaun and Colin Hoult

programme.title: The Monuments Men (2014)
programme.desc: Seven experts in fine art are assembled into a military platoon during the Second World War, and given an unusual mission. They are sent into occupied Europe to recover priceless works of art that have fallen into Nazi hands and ensure the masterpieces survive the conflict. Fact-based drama, directed by and starring George Clooney. With Matt Damon, Bill Murray and Cate Blanchett

programme.desc: Jon Kay and Sally Nugent present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Maximum Security
programme.desc: Dom Littlewood visits Dover to see how Border Force separate the potential smugglers from the tourists. Jenny Donaldson advises a couple whose garden was broken into three times

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin visits the village of Send in Surrey to see a two-up two-down property with potential to extend. Martin Roberts is in Derby to visit a three-bedroom semi that he feels needs opening up to make the most of its space, and Martel Maxwell is in Co Durham in the village of Blackhill Colliery to see a two-bedroom end-of-terrace with a very low sounding guide price. All properties are auctioned and the hosts talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Kimberley Walsh and Gethin Jones host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and YouTuber Jim Browning join forces with ethical hackers to hunt down cyber criminals. Using the same remote-access technology that criminals use to scam their victims, the team hacks the hackers and monitors their operation

programme.title: Maximum Security
programme.desc: Dom Littlewood sees how security works at one of Britain's largest exhibition venues. He also goes on patrol with the Port of Dover police as they sweep a ferry

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The presenters follow the development of a terraced house in Ramsbottom in Bury, a former shop in Gravesend in Kent and a house in Newcastle-under-Lyme, Staffordshire

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp hosts, as former Eurovision stars Cheryl Baker, SuRie, Carrie Grant and Andy Abraham compete to buy and sell items for profit. Experts Charles Hanson and Thomas Forrester assist the contenders, while Natasha also dips into the world of Eurovision collectibles and looks back at some of the contest's memorable moments, from its launch in 1956 to the global phenomenon it is today

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: Still reeling from the state she found her dad in last night, Niamh suggests he might be suffering from post-traumatic stress disorder following his car crash. Meanwhile, a blues festival take a sinister when a woman arrested for driving while intoxicated claims that she was spiked

programme.title: Countryfile Spring Diaries
programme.desc: Jules Hudson visits a charity that helps to rehome bereaved pets, Paul Martin meets a community who are determined save the last native British daffodil and Ellie Harrison explores some tree houses for grown-ups

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton travels to rural Perth and Kinross on a mission to help a young couple from Edinburgh realise their dream of a new lifestyle in a rural home

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers welcomes five more sellers to the Bidding Room, where they try to sell items to five professional dealers who are on the lookout for interesting pieces, with help from expert Simon Bower. Here, dealers Adi, Melissa, JB, Moses, Lucy, Samantha and Ian bid against one another on a set of mid-century cinema-style seats, Victorian wooden spinning tops, a silver cigarette case, a creepy head-shaped pot and an iconic 1960s movie poster

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Former Coronation Street Sally Lindsay reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: BBC Newsline; Weather
programme.desc: Local news from across Northern Ireland, with Tara Mills and Declan Harvey

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: An election broadcast by one of the political parties

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Rylan look ahead to the Eurovision Grand Final and pop star Mika meets some of the people behind the biggest Eurovision hits

programme.title: Eurovision Song Contest - Everyone's a Winner
programme.desc: Taking top spot at Eurovision guarantees fame and fortune - but failing to win is no bar to success either. Fleur East and a panel of celebrity Eurovision super-fans toast the 20 most successful Eurovision songs that didn't win. These are entrants whose songs have gone on to rack up millions of internet views and streams worldwide. Contributors include Claire Sweeney, Scott Mills and Paddy O'Connell

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The last quarter-final sees the week's most talented four cooks return to fight for a place in Knockout Week. They must prepare two courses that will impress not just regular judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also from the 2014 series Ping Coombes, the 2015 series Simon Wood and 2020 series finalist Claire Fyfe

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Comedy actress Diane Morgan hosts, as comedian Desiree Burch and journalist and Times Radio presenter Matt Chorley join in the fun on the satirical current affairs quiz, alongside regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton

programme.title: Black Ops
programme.desc: Undercover police officers Dom and Kay are in a mess - frightened and on their own they have Clinton's body to bury. Dom recalls that Clinton said he was 'protected' and reasons that someone else must know about this mission. They decide to head to Clinton's house, but on the way bump into fellow PCSO Kieran Price who questions their very shaky story about why they're caked in mud. Clinton's house yields an interesting discovery - but Dom and Kay are not the only ones breaking in. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo, Hammed Animashaun and Colin Hoult

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Bikes!
programme.desc: Stephen Watson introduces highlights of the 2023 North West 200, featuring the Supersport and Superstock classes at the nine-mile triangle circuit on the Causeway Coast

programme.title: The Chris & Rosie Ramsey Show
programme.desc: The married couple welcome guests including comedian Joel Dommett and model Hannah Cooper - plus members of the public - to poke fun at life, relationships, annoyances, parenting and absolutely everything in-between. Featuring Please Keep Me Anonymous, where a well-known face reads out some terrifying audience confessions and It Goes or I Go, where audience members compete to rid themselves of something their loved one refuses to remove from the house

programme.title: The Monuments Men (2014)
programme.desc: Seven experts in fine art are assembled into a military platoon during the Second World War, and given an unusual mission. They are sent into occupied Europe to recover priceless works of art that have fallen into Nazi hands and ensure the masterpieces survive the conflict. Fact-based drama, directed by and starring George Clooney. With Matt Damon, Bill Murray and Cate Blanchett

However, the road ahead is hazardous and Ziggy must travel great distances to find food, evade lions and cross crocodile infested rivers. Will he survive, earn his stripes and be promoted to leader of his own zebra squad?
An insight into Lisa Annettes life at 12 years old

programme.title: A' Chuil
programme.desc: Choirstaidh looks at an artist that inspires her, this time it's Andy Warhol

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda
programme.desc: Po is excited to meet a famous wrestler - but finds he is not quite as heroic as he appears

programme.title: Fraochy Bay
programme.desc: Local builders the James brothers get their priorities muddled

programme.title: Live Rugby Union
programme.desc: Boroughmuir Bears v Watsonians (Kick-off 7.45pm). Coverage of the Super Sprint Series match at Meggetland, with commentary by Hugh Dan MacLennan

programme.title: Elena Baltacha
programme.desc: The story of the Scottish tennis player, who became British number one despite suffering with illness throughout her career, before dying of cancer at the age of 30

programme.title: Dealbh is Slighe
programme.desc: Calum Maclean takes a hike up the hills of Assynt to Sgrr an Fhdhleir (The Fiddler), and attempts to take an unusual photo in tune with the wonderful views

programme.title: State of Happiness
programme.desc: It is time for the parliament to vote on which city is to become the oil capital of Norway, and everyone in town is eager to hear the result. Anna makes a decision with consequences for everyone around her. In Norwegian and English

programme.desc: The detective investigates a daring robbery at a port and uncovers a web of intrigue when it turns out to be an inside job. However the insider's motivation isn't just money as his son has been kidnapped to make sure everyone sticks to the plan, which ends up going horribly wrong

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Hill investigates a series of mysterious deaths resembling the various martyrdoms of Christian saints and realises they are being instigated by a shadowy figure who presides over a sinister suicide cult. A local vicar seems the most likely suspect, but his own death rules him out of the investigation - and events culminate in a surprise revelation. Psychological thriller, starring Robson Green

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: Danny and Alice try to keep their new romance a secret, but have more pressing concerns when she is attacked by a lioness - one of several animals on the loose after the storm. Relations between Leopard's Den and Mara reach breaking point when Vanessa refuses to supply drugs to help dying elephant calf Tula, while Du Plessis is delighted when Caroline arrives at the party

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: Danny and Alice are surprised when Rowan allows them to move a herd of circus elephants through his land, despite being on bad terms with them. However, he has an ulterior motive - Mara and Leopard's Den have both been shortlisted for a prize and Rowan wants his rivals distracted when the judges arrive. Meanwhile, as Caroline and Du Plessis prepare for their wedding, an old friend tries to come between them. Drama from the wilds of Africa, starring Stephen Tompkinson, Dawn Steele, Cal Macaninch, Hayley Mills and Deon Stewardson

programme.title: Coastal Devon & Cornwall with Michael Portillo
programme.desc: This final part of Michael's adventure begins on Hope's Nose, a unique headland outside Torquay on the English Rivera, where Michael embraces as many experiences as he can along a coastline formed 280 million years ago, where limestone cliffs give way to eroding sandstone slopes. From exploring prehistoric caves by paddle board to digging for red clay on the Teign estuary, and racing a historic Cornish rowing boat, Michael is determined to capture as many coastal memories as he can, before returning to his urban life in London

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Susan Calman's Grand Day Out
programme.desc: The comedian and her campervan hit the road for a trip to the Yorkshire valleys. At York Minster, she hears about how the people of Yorkshire saved the stunning stained glass during the Second World War. Susan also visits a teddy bear museum, Betty's cafe tea rooms, and takes a miniature steam train ride

programme.title: Dalgliesh
programme.desc: The detective informs everyone that a second person has died, but nobody remembers seeing the victim. Caroline shows Dalgliesh around a curious private flat that leads into the Murder Room. Drama, starring Bertie Carvel

programme.title: Britain's Favourite 80s Songs
programme.desc: Toyah Willcox, Paul Gambaccini, Cheryl Baker and Clare Grogan are among those recalling the music and memories of 1981. It was a year when Bucks Fizz were losing their skirts, Adam and the Ants were re-inventing the pop video, and synthesizer bands were making it big. However, there was still room in the charts for the retro sound of Shakin' Stevens. Narrated by Tony Blackburn

programme.title: Greatest 70s Singer Songwriters
programme.desc: A celebration of the finest singer-songwriters of the 1970s, including Paul McCartney & Wings. In 1973 they crafted one of their best hits with the title theme of 007 epic Live and Let Die. Plus, there's a look at the music and lyrics of Elton John, Bob Marley, Kate Bush, Billy Joel and more

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. In Hammersmith, west London, camera operators help police as they try to enforce a drinking ban on a local park and spot a group whose members may be about to break into a shop

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Walking Britain's Lost Railways
programme.desc: Rob Bell travels to Bangor in north Wales, where he explores a lost line that was built in 1801 to transport Welsh slate from the local quarry, which once was the largest in the world, and now provides the backdrop for the world's fastest zip line. He also follows the Victorian railway inland to Llanberis, where tourists still flock to ride a special train to the summit of Snowdon, and discovers why the heirs to the throne have been styled 'Prince of Wales' for seven centuries

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Emily makes a request that could change Ross's life for ever, presenting him with a huge dilemma. Chandler upsets Monica by gloating about sex, while Joey challenges Phoebe to perform a completely selfless act. Comedy, starring David Schwimmer, Matthew Perry and Courteney Cox

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross delivers devastating news to Rachel - he cannot spend time with her while Emily is in New York. Meanwhile, Joey discovers Chandler's secret romance. Comedy, starring Jennifer Aniston and David Schwimmer

programme.desc: The work of volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey's Amazing Adventures

programme.title: Pip and Posy
programme.desc: Pip finds a lucky stick, which he and Posy use to help their friends. It saves Fox Boy's ice cream, rescues Zac's hat and retrieves Jamila's favourite conker

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Farmer Al's sheep run away, and Mayor Humdinger's kittens go missing

programme.title: The Far Country (1954)
programme.desc: A cowpoke is steering his cattle north to the Canadian border when a corrupt sheriff commandeers the herd. A local saloon-bar owner falls for the hapless cowboy, and with her help he recaptures his cattle. Hooking up with a wagon train, the couple head for the mining town of Dawson, but the thwarted and embittered sheriff is on their tail. Western, with James Stewart, Walter Brennan and Ruth Roman

programme.title: 23 Paces to Baker Street (1956)
programme.desc: A blind playwright overhears a conversation in a London pub concerning a kidnapped child. He goes straight to the police, but they dismiss his story as the product of an overactive imagination, forcing him to take matters into his own hands. With the help of his fiancee and secretary, he sets out to rescue the child and catch the crooks - but his only clue is the scent of a distinctive perfume. Thriller, with Van Johnson, Cecil Parker, Patricia Laffan and Vera Miles

programme.title: Sands of Iwo Jima (1949)
programme.desc: A tough, embittered US marine sergeant sets out to mould a group of raw recruits into men fit for action against the Japanese in the Pacific during the Second World War. Although his training methods are often brutal, his controversial approach looks set to pay dividends when they finally see real combat. Adventure, starring John Wayne, John Agar, Adele Mara and Forrest Tucker

programme.title: Cowboy (1958)
programme.desc: A Chicago hotel clerk befriends a visiting cowboy and soon talks his way into joining him on a cattle drive so he can impress the woman he loves. The tenderfoot has no idea of what awaits him as he ventures out into the Wild West, an experience that forces him to undergo a dramatic change. Western, starring Jack Lemmon, Glenn Ford, Anna Kashfi and Brian Donlevy

programme.title: Failure to Launch (2006)
programme.desc: A thirtysomething man has no intention of leaving the family home, so his exasperated parents respond by hiring a woman who earns her living enticing stay-at-home men to fall in love with her and then encouraging them to fly the nest. Romantic comedy, starring Sarah Jessica Parker, Matthew McConaughey, Kathy Bates and Zooey Deschanel

programme.title: Hunter Killer (2018)
programme.desc: Unconventional submarine skipper Joe Glass is sent to investigate the torpedoing of US and Russian vessels. He winds up trying to rescue the Russian president, who has been kidnapped by a rogue general. Action thriller, starring Gerard Butler, Gary Oldman and Common

programme.title: Heat and Dust (1982)
programme.desc: British researcher Anne is fascinated by the secrecy surrounding her infamous great aunt Olivia, and heads to India to uncover the truth. She learns that in the 1920s, Olivia had a scandalous affair with a local nobleman, and finds herself re-examining her own life as she retraces her relative's footsteps. Drama, starring Julie Christie, Greta Scacchi, Christopher Cazenove and Shashi Kapoor

programme.title: Krisha (2015)
programme.desc: A woman returns for Thanksgiving dinner after a decade away from her family, but past demons threaten to scupper the festivities. Comedy drama, starring Krisha Fairchild and Alex Dobrenko

programme.title: 12 Angry Men (1957)
programme.desc: Twelve jurors convene to decide the verdict in a murder trial. While 11 of the group are thoroughly convinced the teenage defendant is guilty, one lone voice of reason refuses to cave in to pressure and passionately argues the case for his innocence. Sidney Lumet's legal drama, starring Henry Fonda, Lee J Cobb, Ed Begley, Martin Balsam and Jack Klugman

programme.title: Distant Drums (1951)
programme.desc: An army officer mounts a daring raid through the treacherous Florida swamplands. His mission is to take on a group of marauding Seminole rebels, as well as the gun runners who have been supplying them with weapons, and rescue a group of settlers who have been taken hostage by the tribe. Western, starring Gary Cooper, Mari Aldon, Richard Webb, Ray Teal and Arthur Hunnicutt

programme.title: The Yellow Balloon (1953)
programme.desc: A boy dies while playing in the ruins of a London neighbourhood destroyed during the blitz. His friend, who was with him at the time and blames himself, is blackmailed by a murderer on the run, and is forced to steal from his parents to fund the fugitive's escape or be accused of causing his friend's death. Crime drama, starring Andrew Ray and Kathleen Ryan

programme.title: Von Ryan's Express (1965)
programme.desc: A courageous American colonel with a never-say-die attitude is held in a PoW camp. He boldly sets out to lead a group of Allied prisoners in a daring mass escape bid by hijacking a freight train and fleeing through occupied Italy to Switzerland. Second World War action adventure, starring Frank Sinatra, Trevor Howard, Brad Dexter and James Brolin

programme.title: The Addams Family (1991)
programme.desc: Creepy couple Morticia and Gomez find their unconventional life threatened by a man claiming to be a long-lost relative. When they welcome him with open arms, they fall prey to a plot that could cost them their ancestral home and the family fortune. Black comedy based on the 1960s TV series, starring Anjelica Huston, Raul Julia, Christopher Lloyd, Christina Ricci, Jimmy Workman and Carel Struycken

programme.title: Kingsman: The Golden Circle (2017)
programme.desc: Having saved the world once, secret agents Eggsy and Merlin join forces with their US counterparts to bring down a psychotic femme fatale. Thankfully they are assisted by a veteran hero brought back from the dead, and cross paths with a kidnapped Elton John and a couple of killer robot dogs along the way. Director Matthew Vaughn's comedy adventure sequel, starring Taron Egerton, Colin Firth, Mark Strong and Julianne Moore

programme.title: Red Heat (1988)
programme.desc: A Russian detective travels to America to oversee the extradition of a Georgian drug baron responsible for supplying cocaine in Moscow. He is teamed up with a hostile Chicago cop, but when their prisoner kills an officer and escapes, they put aside their mutual mistrust to bring him to justice. Action thriller, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, James Belushi, Peter Boyle, Laurence Fishburne and Ed O'Ross

programme.title: Monsters and Men (2018)
programme.desc: An African-American man named Darius Larson is killed by one of six cops in New York City. The aftermath is revealed through the eyes of the bystander who filmed the act, a police officer, and a gifted high-school baseball player who is inspired to take a stand. Thriller, starring John David Washington and Anthony Ramos

programme.title: Born Free (1966)
programme.desc: Oscar-winning fact-based drama chronicling the lives of game wardens Joy and George Adamson, who adopted an orphaned lion cub in Kenya and trained the animal to survive in the wild so that one day it might return to its natural habitat. Starring Virginia McKenna, Bill Travers and Geoffrey Keen

programme.title: Man of the West (1958)
programme.desc: Reformed outlaw Link is left stranded in the wilderness with a saloon singer and a conman for company when the train they are travelling on is robbed. By chance they stumble upon Link's old gang holed up in a shack, but his former partners in crime threaten violence against them unless Link agrees to take part in a bank robbery. Western, starring Gary Cooper, Lee J Cobb, Julie London and Arthur O'Connell

programme.title: Footsteps in the Fog (1955)
programme.desc: A prominent Victorian gentleman thinks he has got away with poisoning his wife, but his shrewd maid knows the sordid truth and uses it to blackmail him. As the killer's social standing improves, he realises he has to get rid of the scheming servant once and for all, but his plans to dispose of her lead him into even more danger. Period thriller, with Stewart Granger, Jean Simmons and Bill Travers

programme.title: The Long Arm (1956)
programme.desc: A dedicated Scotland Yard police superintendent battles to overcome stress both at home and work, while putting his instincts and scientific knowledge to the task of catching a notorious safecracker. However, the case takes a shocking turn when the elusive criminal commits murder. Crime thriller, starring Jack Hawkins, Dorothy Alison, Geoffrey Keen and Newton Blick

programme.title: Cutthroat Island (1995)
programme.desc: A tough female pirate enlists the help of an educated slave in finding the three parts of a map leading to buried treasure. However, one of the pieces is in the hands of her cruel uncle, and she also has to find the loot before her crew mutinies or the British Navy catches up with her. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Geena Davis, Matthew Modine, Frank Langella and Maury Chaykin

programme.title: Flight (2012)
programme.desc: An airline pilot with a history of heavy drinking and drug use successfully lands a plane that suffers mechanical problems during a fierce storm, saving the lives of nearly everyone on board. While initially hailed as a hero, it later emerges that he was drunk at the time, raising questions about whether he may have contributed to the disaster rather than averted it. Drama, starring Denzel Washington and Don Cheadle

programme.title: The Incredible Hulk (2008)
programme.desc: A bungled experiment causes a scientist to turn into a monster whenever he gets angry. He travels the world seeking a cure for his condition, while a ruthless general is determined to capture him and use the creature as a weapon. However, one of the soldiers under the officer's command undergoes a terrifying transformation of his own. Comic-book adventure, starring Edward Norton, Liv Tyler, Tim Roth and William Hurt

programme.title: Rings (2017)
programme.desc: A young woman finds herself on the receiving end of a terrifying curse that threatens to take her life in seven days. Horror, starring Matilda Anna Ingrid Lutz, Alex Roe and Johnny Galecki

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Ste tries to avoid hurting his best friend Sienna, but he might have no choice if he wants to keep his business afloat. Elsewhere, some damaging papers fall into the wrong hands

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Ste and James want to make amends with Sienna and Maxine. Elsewhere, Goldie is tricked into speaking to Mercedes again

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay goes back to Giuseppi's and Sante La Brea to check in with the owners he helped in the past and find out whether his advice has been put to good use. Will he be pleased with their progress? Plus, an update on Finn McCool's from season one

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to New Jersey's Spanish Pavillion, which is run by two warring brothers whose staff spend more time using their mobile phones than working. The chef plans to turn the eatery's fortunes around, and starts by giving the dining room and menu a modern makeover

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Unexpected revelations are on the cards during the Johnsons' first game night together with the Butlers, when Gemma is prompted to rectify a past wrong

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Dave plans a special anniversary celebration for Gemma while Calvin and Tina babysit the Johnsons' son, Grover, during an evening when nothing goes according to plan

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When Barry Kripke finds proof that Dr Pemberton plagiarised his thesis in college, Sheldon and Amy aren't sure whether they should turn their rival in or not. Howard is surprised but happy to learn that Bernadette wasn't the only waitress at The Cheesecake Factory who had a crush on him back in the day

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard is pleasantly surprised when his mother Beverly arrives and is genuinely kind to him - until he finds out the real reason for her visit. Denise and Stuart overstay their welcome at Howard and Bernadette's. Christine Baranski guest stars

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitch and Cam try to get Lily on their side when they decide to adopt a baby boy, but have doubts about whether they are adequately prepared to raise another child. Meanwhile, Gloria deals with Manny's head teacher

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Cam and Mitch go on diets, and Phil is inspired to try his hand at tightrope walking. Meanwhile, Claire tries to plant ideas in the heads of her warring daughters, and Jay's behaviour grates on Gloria

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine

Meanwhile, Boyle and Diaz must track down kidnapped NYPD horse Sergeant Peanut Butter, and Holt challenges Jeffords to be less image-conscious. Cop comedy, starring Andy Samberg

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine

Meanwhile, at the precinct, Captain Holt and Kevin's special Thanksgiving pie is stolen from Holt's office, so he hunts through the ranks for a possible culprit. Cop comedy, starring Andy Samberg and Melissa Fumero, with guest appearances from Jimmy Smits and Katey Sagal

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj feels upset about not being in a relationship, so Penny sets out to find a date and introduces him to a girl he can actually talk to. They hit it off, but when it becomes apparent he has been buying her expensive gifts, his friends suspect she is only interested in his wealth

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon's old adversary Wil Wheaton returns and invites everyone to a house-warming party. Leonard is eager to go, but Sheldon threatens to shun him if he attends. However, he soon changes his mind when he finds out that Star Trek: The Next Generation actor Brent Spiner will also be there

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny is forced to take Howard's place in the boys' video-game night while he is otherwise engaged with one of her friends. Simon Helberg, Kaley Cuoco and Johnny Galecki star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj's parents set him up on a blind date in the hope of initiating an arranged marriage, but after a promising start it becomes apparent that the girl in question is more interested in Sheldon. Meanwhile, Penny begins her new job as a bartender. Starring Kunal Nayyar and Jim Parsons

programme.desc: Lily utters her first expletive during her debut as a flower girl, and Claire goes head to head with Duane Bailey in a televised debate for the town council seat. Meanwhile, Jay blames Stella the dog's recent behaviour on Gloria. American comedy, starring Aubrey Anderson-Emmons and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil is so preoccupied with trying to charm a prospective client that he fails to notice the man's behaviour toward Claire. Meanwhile, problems arise when Jay and Gloria open up their doors to Mitch and Cameron, whose house is being fumigated. American comedy, guest starring Greg Kinnear

programme.desc: Cameron seizes the opportunity to celebrate his birthday, which only comes around once every four years, so the pressure is on Mitchell to organise an occasion to remember.
